title.narrative: MoMo 4 Climate Programma Project

description.narrative: Mobilising More 4 Climate (MoMo4C) is a five-year program that aims to bring together entrepreneurs, firms, policymakers, investors and civil society organisations to make green business propositions that tackle the impacts and causes of climate change at a landscape level in developing countries, and to attract investments to implement these initiatives.
MoMo 4 Climate
Non-Labour costs

description.narrative: Count number of outcomes
Count number of outcomes
Count number of outcomes
Count number of outcomes

comment.narrative: Count number of outcomes. The strategic pillar “Business cases for public and private investors” attract investments and develop business cases for climate resilience and sustainable development projects that are embedded in landscape approaches. This strategy seeks to help improve business proposals, focusing on showing the economic and financial feasibility of the proposed activities, as well as seeking strategies to reduce the (perception of) risk by investors.

Count number of outcomes. description.narrative: Count number of outcomes.
Count number of outcomes.
Count number of outcomes.
Count number of outcomes.

comment.narrative: The strategic pillar “Enabling environment” aims to strengthen the conditions that enable climate resilience and sustainable development strategies consistent within the landscapes. This pillar addresses the lack of climate awareness by different stakeholders by implementing self-assessments of climate vulnerability, analysis of financial flows and their impact on the objectives of the multi-stakeholder groups in the landscape. It defines the climate action priorities for which additional finance will be necessary or for which barriers to financing need to be reduced.

The strategic pillar “Enabling environment” aims to strengthen the conditions that enable climate resilience and sustainable development strategies consistent within the landscapes. It defines the climate action priorities for which additional finance will be necessary or for which barriers to financing need to be reduced.

comment.narrative: Count number of outcomes. The strategic pillar “Harvesting lessons” is focused on investors, policymakers and NGOs involved in the identification and development of successful business cases. This strategy aims to strengthen the process of learning from the program experiences by documenting these and sharing the lessons learned.
